text:
Blind tasted with 4 other session ipas. IPAs were: 1. 
Lord Hobo Hobo Life 2. Full Sail Session IPA 3. Golden Road Wolf Pup Session IPA 4. Snake River Pakitos Session IPA 5. Samuel Adams Session IPA. Rater 1 rated the beers 13452, Rater 2: 331452, rater 3 (ME) 13542.


HAzed gold pour. Wispy, soapy white head. Aroma is citrus, grassy, dank. Flavor is herbal, dilly, juicy fruit. 


Post tasting thoughts:

This was a nice one for sure.

Can. Pours a rusty dark lemon colored pour with a nice ephemeral beige head. Nose is pleasant citrus with much softer pine and resin notes. Taste is citrus with light hops and mild pine. Finishes on the citrusy hoppy notes with a moderately long finish. A very nice session IPA. Quaff Score 8 / 10

Can from Half Time. Pours hazy orange, sheet of head and some strong drippy lace. Nice, clean citrus aroma, grass, pine notes, a little pale malt. Smooth and clean, light body, not watery. Pretty darn good.
Sample at MBCC 2017. Hazy yellow with a white head. Fresh and hoppy with citrus, pineapple, some hay and light caramel. Light and refreshing.
Sample at MBCC 2017. Fresh hoppy smell with citrus. Similar taste. Light body. Spritsy mouthfeel. Light taste.

Provad pÃ¥ MBCC-17. Blekgul i fÃ¤rgen. Smak och doft av ananas, persika, nektarin, grÃ¶n vindruva. Mycket citrusjuicig och rejÃ¤l kropp fÃ¶r stilen. LÃ¤tt och torr men med vÃ¤ldigt mycket smak. Torr beska. Grym session-IPA! Mycket gott.
Canned. Yellow hazy liquid with a white head. Nose is citrus, pine, grapefruit. Taste some caramel malt with a fruity hops side. A very good session for sure!
From tap. Pours cloudy yellow, small white head. Aroma is peachy and citrusy. Mellow fruity. Crisp hoppy. Smooth fruity. Dry and ligering hoppy finish.
From a can poured a copper color with a good amount of head. Light hoppy malty flavor with a quick finish.
Fat pÃ¥ MBCC 2017. Blekgul i fÃ¤rgen. Smak och doft av ananas, persika, nektarin, grÃ¶n vindruva. LÃ¤tt och torr men med vÃ¤ldigt mycket smak. Torr beska. Grym session-IPA!

Draught at MBCC 2017, green session. Hazy, golden colour with a thin, white head. Fruity aroma with grape, grasses and pines. Taste is bitter. Medium bodied. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus fruits. Very nice IPA.

Draft at Lord Hobo. Hazy yellow orange with a sticky icky white head. Aroma is great, juicy orange and mango notes, grapefruit, floral. Flavor is a juice bomb, citrusy as hell, dry and rindy, really good-looking intense for the ABV. Medium body, rips you on the feel, really legit. A standout session NE IPA.
Pours hazy straw color with white head. Aromas of lemon, grapefruit, and a touch of grain. Slightly bitter lemon zest and grapefruit rind flavors. Light to medium body with average carbonation.
12oz can at CBC pours a hazy gold with some clumpy, white head. Nose has lemon, grass, chive. Flavors of lemon, parmesan rind, orange. Bitter, dry finish.

From notes. Enjoyed on draft at HunahpuÂ’s Day 2017 on March 11. The pour is a little bit more of a clear-ish darker yellow with a thin ring of white head that seems to stick around for the duration with a good lace. The aroma is actually pretty lax. There is a nice citrus to it, with a hint of hop leaf and a decent malt backbone throughout. There is a bit of lemongrass and a bitter pine with it as well. This is pretty disappointing. The flavor is much of the same. There is citrus present, some light lemongrass. The malts are a little surprising, but the juiciness is half-heartedly there. The mouth feel is a little light and watery with a brighter carbonation and a lingeringly bitter pine and citrus finish. This is decent for a session, but I was hoping for something with a little more to it.

12 oz Can from tavour. About two months old. Nice floral and hoppy nose. A little on the malt forward side for a session. Overall really nicely done. Deep hops are swimming in an oatmeal base with a bit of chocolate. Not bad,
Can. Dark yellow gold. Big citrus and lemon nose and flavor. Very bright. Not a ton of depth, but very pleasant and a good citra showcase.

NYC Beer Week Opening Bash: I believe that this is the beer that I had, as this was the session IPA at the surprise Lord Hobo stand. Pours a really foamy gold with a white head (they were having carbonation problems). Aroma is light citrus. Easy drinking, juicy and bitter. Better than I remember most Lord hobo beers being.
Bright loudy yellow. Straight up citrus and passionfruit. Dry, quaffable with a medium bitter finish. Fantastic for the style
[2/1/17] Draught at Lord Hobo in Cambridge. Cloudy yellow. Oniony and fruity hops aroma with some diacetyl. Flavor has sweetish malt and bitterish fruity and oniony hops. Quite light-bodied.
Can from Wegmans into an English Pint. Aroma is floral and pine hops. Very smooth.
Cloudy gold with a big fluffy and soapy head. Aroma is lemony fresh hops. nice bright fresh hops. easy to drink and delicious.

36cl bottle shared in CW. Many thanks to Leighton for this one. It pours a clean golden color with a small white head. Aroma is danky with notes of weed and grass. Taste is also grassy with more weeedy sticky danky notes. Medium bodied with good carbination. Overall, nice

Can split at Happy New Years L42 Shim Sham, thanks to LKS, 12/01/17. 
Hazed golden orange with a decent off white covering.
Nose is tangerine, pissy citrics, lemon sherbets, orange pith, straw.
Taste comprises punchy citrics, melon tang, orange pith, light grapefruit, toasted bread, straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid SIPA ... good balance finishing with grassy hop bitterness.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Keg at WoB Syracuse. Hazy yellow, large foamy white head (kicked the keg), good retention. Aroma of pine, pepper, grapefruit, lemongrass, pale malt. Taste is pine, grapefruit, lemon, pale malt. Medium bodied, lingering bitterness, well balanced.

Can, as part of a trade with Leighton. Cheers! Hazy, pale gold. Film of off white head. Nose has orange pulp. Sweet vanilla malts. Notes of lime leaf and privet leaf. Taste is light, citrus rind bitter. Clean and crisp mouthfeel. More citrus on the finish, with a clean, drying close. Great sessioner.

Can at home in London - picked up at the Hanover Co-Op. Pours mostly clear gold with a creamy, pure white head. The nose holds pale grains, pithy citrus, grapefruit, lemon peel and pine needles. Light sweet flavour with crackery pale malts, ripe lemon, biscuits, a little melon, pine needles, faint grass. Light bodied with average carbonation. Nicely balanced finish with more pithy citrus, subtle piney noes, dry pale malts. Solid session offering.
can, cloudy hazy yellow. smells like grapefruit peel. sweet flavor with dry grassy. lingering pine and grapefruit

Can from Mikkeller web shop cons 2016-12-23 Karlskoga
AR: passion fruit and citrus zest, lemon juice
AP: lemon hazy juice, high frothy yellowish white
head
F: passion fruit, citrus zest, lemon juice, bitter,
Moderate citrus aroma. Cloudy dark yellow color with a medium white head. Moderate bitter beginning that builds to the finish. Slightly light palate.

Draft. Pours a moderate, well retained off white head, with light lacing, over a hazy, yellow body.......nose is citrus with lemon, lime tones, mild malts, balance to the hops.......taste is dry, with heavy citrus tones, light cereal from the malts, moderate bitter finish, balance to the hops......mouth feel, light of medium body, no alcohol, moderate carbonation. This is a pleasant, simple session IPA. The complexity is low, but the hops are utterly dominant. This will be an excellent summer beer. BJCP 8/3/14/4/6

Hazy yellow color with off-white head. Aroma is quite floral and citrusy with nice fruity hops. Taste follows with the nice citrusy hops, also really floral and fresh. Medium bitterness on the finish. Light body and carbonation. Overall itÂ’s a really good, tasty session IPA.
Can from a friend. Pours clear gold with a medium white head dissipating quickly. Nose of malt, lemon and pine. Malty and piney flavor with a grapefruit hop finish.

01.11.2016, 12 oz can @ home:
Nice slightly fizzy mediumlasting head, hazy. Aroma is fresh grassy, leafs, weeds, lawn, hay, minerals, hops, light malts, flowers, bark, hints of pine needles and citrus peel. Taste is dry grassy, weeds, leafs, lawn, bark, hay, minerals, pine needles, moss, light malts, harsh hops. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry and harsh grass mouthfeel. Nice enough, a bit too harsh / bitter taste...
Can from mikkeller webshop. Color is gold. Light hazy. Almost no head. Taste is medium high bitter, light sweet. Thin body. High carbonation. Aroma is pineapple, herby, hops, resin.

Can. Pours a hazed gold with a large white head. Big bright citrus on the nose, soft musk, a bit of fruit. Medium bodied, soft and fruity with a nice tropical note to it, some soft malt and a bit of citrus. Gentle musk, fruit, a bit of fuzzy yeast into the finish.

Draught @ The Jeffreys. Cloudy pale yellow with foamy off-white head, lemon peel aroma, low carbonation, bitter hoppy taste with lemon peel flavor, thin body, medium bitter finish. Nice and refreshing, not very stronng.
golden hued pour, white head. clear. nice dankness, citrus, oranges. ample bitterness and a light body.

Aroma: fruity hops with strong citrus. 
Flavour: Fruity bitterness with berries and notes of grapefruit. Finish is dry and bitter. 
Colour: yellow with a white head. 
From: can @ Mikkeller Bottle Shop Aarhus Sept. 2016.
Draft sample at the source. Hazy yellow with a white head of foam. Dry floral and citrus notes are in the aroma. Dry, moderate bitterness in the taste. Lighter body and moderate carbonation.

Can. Thanks Drew. Hazy bright yellow with a thin, white head that lasts and laces some. Aromas of lemon zest, grapefruit, pine, grass, biscuit, light floral notes. Flavor is the same Citrus upfront with some bitter pine, grass, floral notes and a toasty biscuity finish. Light plus bodied, smooth with a dry end.

10th August 2016GBBF Day 2. Cask. Hazy gold beer, a few white bubbles. Palate is light, semi dry and has good fine carbonation. Smooth light sweetish malts. Nice light vanilla - coconut. Good hop spice. Tangerine - orange. Light dry spicy finish. Nice.
Draft with label - pours yellow white head - nose/taste of citrus, malt, lemon and pine - medium body
Hazy golden, white froth. Fruity passionfruit, pine and peach aroma. Flavour has lemon and passionfruit, light, cleansing piney bitterness. Light but juicy, very flavourful and drinkable.
Can. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter finish.
Can @ Boys night out at the Hill Of The Dragon. Hazy golden body with a small white head. Citrus, hops, light soapy, floral.
Can @ Boys Night out at the Hill of the dragon. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Juicy grapefruity hops. Floral and grassy. Nice! Crisp!

Bottle @ Boys night out, a the hill of the dragon. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of tropical, tangerine, citrusy, quite grassy. Taste is rather bitter, with loads if citrus and tropical fruits. Bitter and dry. Decent
Pours a slightly hazy dark straw from a tap. Big citrus and pine aroma followed in the mouth. Thin as is typical for session IPAs, one-dimensional, but true to style. Good beer.
Can. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a medium white head. Notes of citrus, wet grass, melon, grapefruit, pineapple.
Can @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Light hazy golden pour with a frothy head. Notes of juicy citrus, grape fruit, light pine needles and juicy stone fruit. Good!
Pour cloudy yellow with a small White head. Heavy pine aroma,, light floral and lemon. Taste medium bitter, average carbonation medium Bodied heavy bitter finish

Canned. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, peachy and pineapple notes and some apricot. Sweet flavor that ends up being dry and bitter. Light to medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A nice SIPA indeed. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ
Can @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich citrus, fruits, flowers, pine, malt and hops. Nice fruity and bitter finish.
Can at home - pre tasting/hygge Bajer. Clear yellow/golden - white head. Fresh hoppy. Citra yes. Citrus. Light malty. Toasted notes. Ok bitterness. So fresh - High drinkability.

Can @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - grapefruit and fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 170916
Can, 4.5%. Hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, peach, little earthy and citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, grapefruit,
Can @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of citrus, light resin, light hoppy fruit. Hazy golden yellow with white head, not lasting. Moderate+ bitter and light sweet. Light+ body, oily feel, bitter finish.
Can. Pours hazy yellow with a White head. Aroma of herby hops, citrus, peach, orange and citrus. The taste is bitter and hop forward. Herbs, citrus, slight mango, herbs and pine.

Pours hazy yellow with low white head 
Aromas of passion fruit, mango, resin, caramel, citrus 
Taste has notes of mango, passion fruit, citrusy fruits, resin, caramel

Pours hazy golden with a low white head. Aromas of passion fruit, mango, citrus, apricot. Taste is fruity and slightly floral with moderate bitterness. Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation.
Pours cloudy yellow with low white head. Aroma of passion fruit, mango, light lime. Taste is mild bitter with a fruit sweet finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2017 August 2016 - Cask, gravity dispense at GBBF 2016 as Â’Lord Hobo Hobo LifeÂ’. Hazy golden yellow, no real head from my pour. Aroma is lemony, dank, grapefruit, grassy. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is straw, gummy sweets, grassy. A tasty fruity golden ale. Nice balance and drinkability. There are similar UK golden ales which donÂ’t get the recognition. (3.7)
January 2017 - Can share thanks to Leighton.  Quite floral, grapefruit.  Nice.  (3.7)

Can @ Best Western Plus Waterbury. Lightly hazed golden yellow beer with a finger of white head. It has a decent bit of grapefruit and citrus along with some canned pineapple. ThereÂ’s a bit of a floral and honey sweetness along with some bread, which I wouldnÂ’t necessarily have anticipated. Fair amount of bitterness of pine and grapefruit peel. Good mouthfeel at least. Drying finish despite a pronounced malt profile.

Can - the pour is a hazy, dull gold yellow with a med to thin off white head that dissipates. I love the aroma of peach, mango and citrusy hops along with light cracker type malt. Funky sediment in the bottom of my glass. Delicious hop bouquet flavor for a sessionable IPA ( not too watery ). I can easily put down a few of these.

Sample at GBBF 2016, Wednesday. Hazy goldrn beer with a small head. Hoppy fruity aroma, citrus, grapes, hay notes, floral, some hay. Hoppy citrus flavor, dill, grapes, floral notes. Nice hops in this one.

12 oz can. Pours very murky dark gold with a big rocky white head that retains well and leaves some lacing.

The aroma is leafy fruity hops with a little resin.

The flavor is yeasty doughy malts with fruity resiny hops with a good amount of bitterness that lingers. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation.

Overall, a very nice seission IPA. A bit too much yeasty malt.

Sampled @ GBBF Day 2. A bit hazy chemically looking bright yellow color, virtually no head. Smell and taste are both very hoppy, very fruity, tropical fruits. A bit sweet perhaps but I very much like it even though itÂ’s only got a slight bitterness. Nice!

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2017 Cask at GBBF 2016 09/08/2016. A vibrant yellow green coloured pour with a small white head. Aroma is juicy zesty lemon, lime, pale grains. Flavour is composed juicy orange tangerine, apricot, mango. Pineapple, wheat. Palate is semi sweet grainy hop good cask condition. Lovely. 

Can thanks to Leighton.  Still tasting really good.
Gbbf. Fast klare leuchtend gelbe Farbe. Geruch zitronig spritzig hopfig. Geschmack sehr hopfig, Ananas, citrusfrÃ¼chte, gut!

Cask at GBBF 2016. It pours hazy bright yellow with a small white head. The aroma is rich, sweet, juicy, danky, grass, peach, nectarine, hay and lemongrass. The taste is smooth, crisp, bitter, juicy, dank, grassy, sticky, apricot, peach, yellow plum, drying, straw with a drying finish. Medium body and soft, but decent carbonation. Fresh, dank and delcious. Excellent stuff.

Single can from JulioÂ’s. Pours out a murky light orange color. Thin white head. Huge citrus aromas. Smooth and drinkable up front. Flavor is very nice grapefruit rind with floral-spice notes. Lots of bitterness on the backside. Very respectable for a session IPA.

Fresh can. This is a really nice session IPA thatÂ’s dominated by Citra. It smells like Citra, tastes like Citra, and even has the word "Citra" printed in the middle of the label. Which is a good thing, because Citra is absolutely delicious, and this beer is too.

Can. Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is cloudy medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately hoppy (grapefruit, grass, resin), with a note of diacetyl. Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, moderately bitter. Light to medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

Diacetyl and unpleasant sourness make this pretty difficult to enjoy. Both are recurring problems for this brewery, it seems. Very grapefruity hops. Not terrible by any means, but definitely needs some work.

Tap at Worthy Burger, also can. Wow. So excited to share this light golden beauty with my pal, harmphilstead. Incredible citra hops feature, light bodied and so easy-drinking. I was lucky enough to visit Worthy Burger in South Royalton, VT on a Lord Hobo event night. A delightful session ensued.

Can. Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of citrus, lemon, tropical fruits, grapefruit, bitter hops. Very fruity and hoppy. Flavor of citrus, lime, crackery malt, bitter hops, tropical fruits, bitter finish. Excellent session IPA, lots of hops and fruity notes.
8/4/8/4/14 (3.8/5)
Pours light gold, thin white head. Aroma is light bread, citrus, grass, faint pineapple. Flavor is mild citrus, grass, faint pine. Nice citra focused session
Can from Craft Beer Cellar, Waterbury. Nice citrus aroma. Very citrusy taste with a dry bitter finish. The finish is very grapefruity and bitter. Good session IPA.

Can. Light golden, lots of hops in suspension, quite nice looking. ARoma is slightly vegetal but not much, alot of good tropical fruity citra. Light and clean, heavily hopped, no bitterness. Good stuff.

12oz can. Medium off-white head atop murky apple cider body. Aroma is moderately sweet, tangerine, some grapefruit rind. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, light grapefruit rind. Effervescent light-medium body, chalk.

From can itÂ’s hazed gold with a thin white head. Aroma impression is pineapple, resin, and onion (typical of Citra), with some more nuanced honeysuckle and dandelion and lime notes. In the mouth itÂ’s medium-light bodied, strongly bitter but with enough malt body, a proper balance for these sub-5% ales that are so often thin. The malt aroma/flavor is actually quite rich, toffee, baked bread, seeds/nuts, I can see a resemblance to English malt here, and it has me putting up with the absurd bitterness.

Can. Golden pour with a big white head. Aroma is light grains, lemon and good grapefruit and pine. Flavor is lemon, grapefruit. Grapefruit peel bitterness in the finish. Flavors are good, but this is noticeably thin, good session.

Hazy golden with a thin, sticky white head. Lovely herbal and floral resinous nose with a little orange pith. Lovely dry and earthy, pithy citrus bitterness right on the front of the palate. Crisp and dry, though a little piney and acidic.

Tap at the Jeffrey. Orange gold beer small head nose is unremarkable citrus pine and plastic. Tastes better of piney hops, pineapple, mango, biscuits, touch medicinal. Smooth palate but could use a kick of something.

Cloudy pineapple yellow color. Medium meringue of head. Good carbonation of tiny bubbles. Looks more like a witbier.

Aroma is the grains of paradise (slight) and a oily, woody hop. Perfumey aroma. Hop-forward, to be sure. A little basement must, a little mint leaf. A tiny off-aroma of plastic but I get that with a lot of sesh-IPAs.

The flavor is a pretty standard hop; the malts are prickly bitter. Just a hint of blood orange and lemon zest. The citra hops add a very bitter finish. 

The feel of the beer is a bit pillowy, and with some carbonated bounce. ItÂ’s a fine, one-note beer that wouldnÂ’t be my first choice but could do in a pinch.
12 oz via can, mostly chugged. Zesty, light, refreshing and easy to drink. Hints of grapefruit, tropical fruit, earth and biscuit malt.

Taster pour at Sierra Nevada Beer Camp Across America. Aroma is corn chip, strong pine, light resin. Appearance is pale yellow (urine-like) with small white fizzy head. Taste is similar to aroma. Palate is light bodied with thin texture, average carbonation and balanced sweet/bitter, dry finish. Overall, nice, light refreshing session beer with good aroma and taste.
can. Hop flavored citra seltzer. Meh, too light and carb is too high. The carb takes over, citra is the rest. No malts.

Ok session beer. Bit watery for my taste but overall goes down nicely with some hop in the background.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. can. Yellow and a little hazy with a medium white head. Smells of nice citra hops. A little grain. Taste also has a nice citra hop flavor. Bright orange and a little lemon. Pleasant cracker and sweet pale malt. Moderate bitterness. Light body. Well carbonated. Tasty and really easy to drink.
Crisp dry pine citrus hop aroma. Hazy yellow body topped with a snow white soap bubbly head. Mild bitterness with a dry resin and citrus taste. Clean crisp finish and refreshing.

Can from Colonial Spirits in Acton.
Mostly clear light golden color with a huge persisting bubbly white head. Earthy spicy and pine with a solid shot of tropical fruits, some mineral water, and a touch of crackery maltiness. the flavor is more earthy pine than fruit but they both share the stage. Faint malty character and dryness could be amped up a bit just to counter the shear lupulin presence. Probably my favorite LH beer so far.

Can. Funky hop aroma--earthy red onion, garlic, moss--rounded out by sugar cookies and sweet tangerine. Flavor adds some grapefruit pith to this blend, leading with citrus but fading into the sweaty hop notes. Finishes with low bitterness and a flash of citrusy flavor. Very flavorful, clean and crushable.
Poured a slightly hazy light gold color. Smelled of grassy and piny hops. Tastes mostly of subtle hops and light citrus. While it may lack in flavor, it is super smooth and crisp.

12oz can from Redstone. Pours yellow gold with a big white head. Aroma is light grains, lemon, grapefruit. Flavor is biscuit, lemon, grapefruit. Grapefruit peel bitterness in the finish. Flavors are good, but this is noticeably thin. Still, this might be the best Lord Hobo has to offer.

Smells of huge citrus hops with some dry malts on the back of the nostils. Awesome slightly cloudy yellow color me favorite. Taste starts of dry then getting huge rind flavor and bitterness coming through then finishing off smooth and dry. Med body with zesty crisp carbonation. Very tasty session ipa love all your brews thous far looking for a stout from you guys. Nice work.

12 oz. can without any date coding. Hazy yellow with very thin lasting legs of lacing. Aroma is a great level of lemons, grapefruit and citrus rind. Really promising on the nose. 
The aroma was leading me to believe that I would receive a blast of citrus goodness. Well, it falls flat. The grapefruit is here without a doubt but it becomes overly astringent. And as far as the session IPA style goes, most 4.5% brews come off as watery. This body falls into the same watery classification as does 90 % of all other in the "session" category. For me this is mediocre at best.

Poured from can hazy golden color with a thin fading white head. Aromas of biscuit light honey and fresh Citra hops. Taste is mildly sweet with notes of caramel and biscuit as well as a lingering bitterness.
Beautifully hopped, with lots of grapefruit and lemon zest. Nice and dry, with a wheat finish. Will definitely buy again.

Undated can from Fort Point Market, drunk 3/12/16.Lightly hazy pour is golden-copper with a large white head that settles to one finger with moderately strong retention.Citra is prevalent in the nose, as one would expect from a citra IPA. But itÂ’s free from cat urine or other ammonia compounds and isnÂ’t heavy on the grapefruit rind nor is there any resin. Pretty nice! Lots of biscuit and very light honey with no alcohol or flaws.Great texture emerges from well-attenuated malts and light honey and biscuit character. Lemon, orange rind and hints of softer fruitiness, with dry pineapple. All classic citra, but done about as well as can be. Kind of reminds me of citra sunshine slacker, though less dusty/earthy/weird than that one, but still just as drinkable. Great carbonation and no alcohol or flaws. Gets just a touch too bitter and grapefruit-heavy for my liking, near the end of the glass, but otherwise much, much improvement from LH Brewing.
From the can. Grapefruit and tropical fruit aromas. Soft with bitter, earthy grapefruit pith front to back. Dry, medium length finish. Not bad.
